Package chess_game

Class Rook

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess_game.Piece
      • chess_game.Rook
  • public class Rook
extends Piece
    Rooks always start in one of the four corners of the board. Each team starts with two Rooks. They can move freely in a straight horizontal or vertical line. If both a Rook and the allied King have yet to move, they can perform a special maneuver called castling.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Rook​(java.util.ArrayList<Pair> move, boolean color, Pair location)  

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void castle​(King k)
      Requires both the Rook in question and the allied King to have hasMoved be False, the King to have inCheck be False, the spaces between the Rook and King to be empty, and the spaces the king passes through must be free of attack by enemies.

      • Methods inherited from class chess_game.Piece

        getColor, getCurrentLocation, getMovementPattern, move, setHasMoved

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • castle

        public void castle​(King k)
        Requires both the Rook in question and the allied King to have hasMoved be False, the King to have inCheck be False, the spaces between the Rook and King to be empty, and the spaces the king passes through must be free of attack by enemies. Moves the King two spaces towards the Rook, and moves the Rook to the space the King just crossed through (ie if the King moves left 2 spaces, the Rook moves 1 space right of the King) Sets hasMoved to True for both King and Rook.
        Parameters:
        k - The King being used in this move.
